title: RED: Write failing tests for MongoDataStore adapter
description:
TDD Red Phase: Write comprehensive failing tests for a new MongoDataStore that wraps mongo.do.

## Tests to Write
1. Connection tests - connect to mongo.do (local SQLite mode)
2. CRUD tests - create/read/update/delete with MongoDB client
3. Query operator tests - $gt, $lt, $in, $or, $regex
4. Sorting tests - orderBy ascending/descending
5. Relation tests - $lookup for joins
6. Schema validation tests - reject invalid data
7. Transaction tests - multi-document ACID

## Test File
`packages/schema/src/__tests__/mongo-data-store.test.ts`

## Expected Interface
```typescript
const store = new MongoDataStore(schema, {
  uri: 'mongodb://localhost:27017',
  database: 'saaskit-test'
})
await store.connect()
const user = await store.create('User', { name: 'Alice' })
const users = await store.findAll('User', {
  where: { age: { $gt: 18 } },
  orderBy: { name: 'asc' },
  limit: 10
})
```

title: Update examples to use mongo.do backend
description:
Update all example apps to use the new MongoDataStore with mongo.do.

## Changes Per Example
1. Update seed.ts to use MongoDataStore
2. Add mongo.do dev server start script
3. Update README with new setup instructions
4. Demonstrate query power (sorting, filtering, relations)

## Examples to Update
- examples/todo - Simple CRUD with relations
- examples/crm - Complex queries, aggregations
- examples/blog - Many-to-many, text search
- examples/project-tracker - Kanban queries, time tracking

## New Developer Experience
```bash
# Start mongo.do local server
npx mongo.do serve --backend sqlite --port 27017

# Run seed script
bun examples/todo/seed.ts

# Use CLI with full query power
saaskit todo list --where '{"completed": false}' --orderBy '{"priority": "desc"}'
```

title: GREEN: Implement relation-aware query builder
description:
TDD Green Phase: Implement aggregation pipeline builder for relations.

## Implementation
`packages/schema/src/query-builder.ts`

## Features
1. Build $lookup stages from schema relations
2. Handle belongsTo, hasMany, many-to-many patterns
3. Support nested relation paths
4. Optimize pipelines (avoid N+1)
5. Handle circular relation detection

## Key Functions
```typescript
function buildLookupPipeline(
  schema: SaaSSchema,
  resource: string,
  include: string[]
): AggregationStage[]

function buildMatchStage(where: QueryWhere): AggregationStage

function buildSortStage(orderBy: OrderBy): AggregationStage
```

`packages/schema/src/zod-generator.ts`

- Handle optional/required modifiers
- Generate z.enum() for select/enum fields

- Handle default values
- Generate TypeScript types alongside schemas

```typescript

  schemas: Record<string, ZodSchema>
  types: string  // TypeScript type definitions
}
```

title: RED: Relation-aware query builder tests
description:
TDD Red Phase: Write failing tests for building MongoDB aggregation pipelines from schema relations.

## Tests
1. belongsTo lookup - Todo.list → $lookup to List collection
2. hasMany lookup - List.todos → $lookup with localField
3. Many-to-many via junction - Post.tags → double $lookup via PostTag
4. Nested relations - Deal.company.contacts → chained $lookup
5. Eager loading syntax - { include: ['author', 'tags'] }
6. Populate selected fields only

## Expected Interface
```typescript
const posts = await store.findAll('Post', {
  where: { status: 'published' },
  include: ['author', 'tags'],
  orderBy: { createdAt: 'desc' }
})
// Returns posts with author and tags populated
```

title: RED: Schema-to-Zod type generator tests
description:
TDD Red Phase: Write failing tests for generating Zod schemas from SaaSkit YAML schemas.

## Tests
1. Primitive types → Zod types (string, number, boolean, date)
2. Optional fields → z.optional()
3. Required fields → proper validation
4. Enum fields → z.enum()
5. Relation fields → z.string() (ObjectId reference)
6. Auto fields (id, createdAt, updatedAt) → proper defaults
7. Nested validation (email, url patterns)
8. Full resource → complete Zod object schema

## Expected Output
```typescript
const { schemas, types } = generateZodSchemas(saaskitSchema)

// schemas.User is a Zod schema
const validated = schemas.User.parse({ name: 'Alice', email: 'alice@x.com' })

// TypeScript type inference
type User = z.infer<typeof schemas.User>
```

title: Integrate mongo.do MCP server for AI agents
description:
Leverage mongo.do's built-in MCP server for AI agent integration.

## Goal
Instead of building our own MCP server, configure and expose mongo.do's MCP capabilities through SaaSkit schema.

## Tasks
1. Configure mongo.do MCP server with SaaSkit schema metadata
2. Generate MCP tool descriptions from schema fields/relations
3. Add schema-aware prompts and examples
4. Test with Claude Desktop integration

## MCP Tool Generation
From SaaSkit schema:
```yaml
Todo:
  title: text
  completed: boolean
  priority: low | medium | high
```

Generate MCP tools:
- `todo_create` - Create a new todo
- `todo_list` - List todos with filtering
- `todo_update` - Update a todo
- `todo_delete` - Delete a todo
- `todo_find` - Find todos by criteria

title: GREEN: Implement MongoDataStore adapter
description:
TDD Green Phase: Implement MongoDataStore to pass all tests.

## Implementation
1. Create `packages/schema/src/mongo-data-store.ts`
2. Wrap mongo.do MongoClient/Collection
3. Transform SaaSkit schema resources to MongoDB collections
4. Map findAll() where clause to MongoDB query syntax
5. Handle relation traversal via $lookup aggregation
6. Generate Zod schemas from SaaSkit schema for validation

## Key Methods
- `connect()` - Initialize mongo.do client
- `create(resource, data)` - insertOne with validation
- `findById(resource, id)` - findOne by _id
- `findAll(resource, options)` - find with full query support
- `update(resource, id, data)` - updateOne
- `delete(resource, id)` - deleteOne
- `getRelated(resource, id, relation)` - $lookup pipeline

## Dependencies
- mongo.do package
- Schema-to-Zod converter

title: REFACTOR: Unify DataStore interface for pluggable backends
description:
TDD Refactor Phase: Create a clean DataStore interface that both MemoryDataStore and MongoDataStore implement.

## Interface Design
```typescript
interface DataStoreAdapter {
  connect(): Promise<void>
  disconnect(): Promise<void>
  
  create<T>(resource: string, data: Partial<T>): Promise<T>
  findById<T>(resource: string, id: string): Promise<T | null>
  findAll<T>(resource: string, options?: QueryOptions): Promise<T[]>
  findOne<T>(resource: string, options?: QueryOptions): Promise<T | null>
  update<T>(resource: string, id: string, data: Partial<T>): Promise<T>
  delete(resource: string, id: string): Promise<boolean>
  
  count(resource: string, options?: QueryOptions): Promise<number>
  aggregate<T>(resource: string, pipeline: AggregationStage[]): Promise<T[]>
}

interface QueryOptions {
  where?: MongoQuery  // MongoDB-style query
  orderBy?: Record<string, 'asc' | 'desc'>
  limit?: number
  offset?: number
  include?: string[]  // Relations to eager load
}
```

## Deliverables
1. `packages/schema/src/adapters/interface.ts` - Abstract interface
2. `packages/schema/src/adapters/memory.ts` - Refactored in-memory store
3. `packages/schema/src/adapters/mongo.ts` - mongo.do adapter
4. Factory function: `createDataStore(schema, config)`

title: Epic: Re-architect SaaSkit to use mongo.do as data layer
description:
Re-envision SaaSkit core abstraction to delegate data storage to mongo.do, focusing SaaSkit on schema-to-service transformation.

## Vision
SaaSkit provides the schema layer, mongo.do provides the data layer:
- YAML schema → mongo.do collections
- Schema validation → Zod + mongo.do $jsonSchema
- Relations → mongo.do $lookup pipelines
- Workflows → mongo.do update + change streams
- MCP → mongo.do MCP server

## Benefits
- Full MongoDB query power (no more missing $gt, $in, $or)
- Real-time change streams
- Vector search for AI
- Transactions
- Local SQLite dev, Cloudflare edge production

## Dependencies
- mongo.do package integration
- Schema-to-collection factory
- Relation-aware query builder
